IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: BRIDGING THE GAP BETWEEN EARLY-STAGE INNOVATION AND COMMERCIAL APPLICATION. PARTNERING TO DE-RISK, DEVELOP AND SCALE-UP DISCOVERIES INTO COMMERCIALLY-VIABLE TECHNOLOGY PACKAGES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: BRIDGING THE GAP BETWEEN EARLY-STAGE INNOVATION AND COMMERCIAL APPLICATION. PARTNERING TO DE-RISK, DEVELOP AND SCALE-UP DISCOVERIES INTO COMMERCIALLY-VIABLE TECHNOLOGY PACKAGES.
IRS990.Description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT - PRIVATE, NOT-FOR-PROFIT TECHNOLOGY RESEARCH AND BUSINESS-DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION ORGANIZED TO MEET AGRICULTURAL, INDUSTRIAL, AND ENVIRONMENTAL MARKET NEEDS BY INVENTING AND IN-LICENSING COMMERCIALLY PROMISING TECHNOLOGIES. ADDITIONALLY, WORKS WITH INDIVIDUALS, INDUSTRY, AND GOVERNMENT TO DEVELOP AND COMMERCIALIZE BIO-BASED PRODUCTS AND PROCESSES THROUGH THE START-UP OF NEW BUSINESS, THE FORMATION OF STRATEGIC RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT, AND COMMERCIALIZATION OF BIOPRODUCTS AND BIOPROCESSES, WITH THE RESIDENT EXPERTISE TO DEVELOP, SCALE-UP, AND VALIDATE BIOPROCESSES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: MBI, INC. DOES NOT HOLD ENDOWMENTS. THE ENDOWMENTS ARE HELD BY MSU FOUNDATION. MSU FOUNDATION IS THE SOLE MEMBER OF MBI, INC. THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE HELD ON BEHALF OF MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY TO BE PAID OUT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS ACCORDING TO THE ENDOWMENT AGREEMENT.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 1A
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: DAVID JONES RECEIVES A 1,500 MONTHLY HOUSING ALLOWANCE. THIS COMPENSATION WAS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND IS INCLUDED IN MR. JONES' TAXABLE WAGES.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: COMPENSATION CONTINGENT UPON REVENUES OF ORGANIZATION
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 5A
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: BONUSES WERE PAID IN 2009. THE BONUS PLAN IS BASED ON THE ORGANIZATION REACHING PREDETERMINED FINANCIAL AND TECHNICAL GOALS FOR THE YEAR. THE BONUS IS NOT A GUARANTEED BONUS.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: COMPENSATION CONTINGENT UPON NET EARNINGS OF ORGANIZATION
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 6A
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: BONUSES WERE PAID IN 2009. THE BONUS PLAN IS BASED ON THE ORGANIZATION REACHING PREDETERMINED FINANCIAL AND TECHNICAL GOALS FOR THE YEAR. THE BONUS IS NOT A GUARANTEED BONUS.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: 100% OF MBI'S STOCK IS HELD BY MSU FOUNDATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ELECTION OF MEMBERS AND THEIR RIGHTS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: MEMBERS OF THE MSU FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE ALSO MEMBERS OF MBI'S BOARD AND THEREFORE MSU FOUNDATION (STOCKHOLDER) IS INVOLVED IN THE DECISION MAKING PROCESS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: DECISIONS SUBJECT TO APPROVAL OF MEMBERS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: MEMBERS OF THE MSU FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE ALSO MEMBERS OF MBI'S BOARD AND THEREFORE MSU FOUNDATION (STOCKHOLDER) IS INVOLVED IN THE DECISION MAKING PROCESS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM AND IT IS REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT (PRESIDENT/CEO, VP, AND FINANCE & ADMINSTRATION) AND MBI'S AUDIT COMMITTEE.
CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM IS FILLED OUT AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH CALENDAR YEAR AND REVIEWED.

THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO OF THE ORGANIZATION INVOLVED THE FOLLOWING: UTILIZING THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, INDEPENDENT CONSULTANTS, USING COMPENSATION SURVEYS, FINAL APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, FINALIZING THE SALARY PACKAGE WITH A WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST COMPLETED IN 2010.

THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR THE OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION INVOLVED THE FOLLOWING: UTILIZING THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, INDEPENDENT CONSULTANTS, USING COMPENSATION SURVEYS, FINAL APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, FINALIZING THE SALARY PACKAGE WITH A WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST COMPLETED IN 2010.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

ALL LINES LEFT BLANK ARE NOT APPLICABLE TO THE ORGANIZATION. FORM 990 PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A - GEORGE BENSON RECEIVES COMPENSATION FOR SERVICES PROVIDED TO A RELATED ORGANIZATION OF MBI, INC. THE AVERAGE HOURS PER WEEK DEVOTED TO PERFORMING SERVICES FOR THE RELATED ORGANIZATION ARE 45 HOURS PER WEEK.
